definitions.text:
Whelp
 [Latin]
1. The young of the canine species, and of several other beasts of prey; a puppy; a cub; as a bear robbed of her whelps; lions whelps.
2. A son; in contempt.
3. A young man; in contempt.WHELP,
To bring forth young, as the female of the canine species and some other beasts of prey.
